_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:
We at Bayer Polymers are committed to employee, public, and environmental safety. This is demonstrated by our accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with the storage and distribution processes at our facility. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances. If such a release were to occur, our trained emergency response personnel are at hand to control and mitigate the effects of the release. We are also coordinated with the local Fire Department which provides additional emergency response expertise.

2. The Facility and the Regulated Substances Handled:
Our facility's primary activities encompass warehousing and wholesaling of chemicals. We have one substance present at our facility that is regulated under the EPA Risk Management Regulation. This substance, toluene diisocyanate, is used as a reactant in the manufacturing of flexible polyurethane foams and other elastomers. No manufacturing of any type or processing of toluene diisocyanate or any other chemical takes place at this facility. The toluene diisocyanate is stored in 55 gallon drums and the maximum inventory at our facility is 300,000 lb.

3. The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps:
We have taken all the necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements. All materials are stored in containers constructed according to Federal Department of Transportation (DOT) requirements. The closed containers are stored in accordance with the National Fire Protection Agency (NFPA) codes. Containers are inspected for integrity when pulling orders for shipment and during the loading process. In addition, the following elements of the release prevention program are in place at our facility.

pation
-Process Safety Information
-Process Hazard Analysis
-Operating Procedures
-Training
-Contractor Safety
-Pre-startup Reviews
-Mechanical Integrity
-Safe Work Practices
-Management of Change
-Incident Investigation
-Compliance Audits

4. Five-year Accident History
Due to our stringent release prevention policies, there has been no accidental release during the last 5 years.

5. Emergency Response Plan
Our facility maintains a written emergency response plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials. The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, as well as post-incident decontamination of affected areas.

To ensure proper functioning, our emergency response equipment is regularly inspected and serviced. In addition, the plan is promptly updated to reflect any pertinent changes taking place within our processes that would require a modified emergency response.

6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety:
There are no new developments and no findings that have resulted from the implementation of the various elements of our accidental release prevention program. No recommendations were made.
